definition.name: NXstm
definition.doc: An application definition to describe Scanning Tunneling Microscopy (STM).

field.name: definition
field.doc: Name of the definition that is used for the STM technique.

field.name: scan_mode
field.doc: The mode of the scan that is performed. Two commonly used modes are constant height mode and constant current mode.

group.name: lockin_amplifier
group.doc: The lock-in amplifier information. The device is being used to extract the very weak signal buried in noisy signals.

field.name: modulation_signal
field.doc: The type of the signal (voltage or current) subject to modulation.

group.name: SCAN_ENVIRONMENT
group.doc:
The environment information for stm or sts experiment.
Note: At least one field from head_temperature, cryo_bottom_temperature and cryo_shield_temperature must be provided.
The scan control information like scan region or phase space, e.g. pattern of scan (e.g. mesh), scanner speed, etc.

field.name: lockin_status
field.doc: The status of the lock-in amplifier. It is well established convention that for topographic measurements lockin amplifier is turned off state while current scan lockin amplifier is turned on.

group.name: head_temperature_sensor
group.doc: This should be a link to /entry/instrument/head_temperature_sensor

group.name: cryo_bottom_temperature_sensor
group.doc: This should be a link to /entry/instrument/cryo_bottom_temperature_sensor

group.name: cryo_shield_temperature_sensor
group.doc: This should be a link to /entry/instrument/cryo_shield_temperature_sensor

group.name: bias_spectroscopy_environment
group.doc: To explain bias and current behavior (sweep measurement) due to voltage applied to the sample.

group.name: reproducibility_indicators
group.doc: The group's concepts hold the link to the related concepts that define the reproducibility of the STM experiment.

field.name: current
field.doc: The tunneling current between tip and sample after application of bias voltage. This should be a link to /entry/instrument/current_sensor/current

field.name: current_offset
field.doc: The offset in tunneling current between tip and sample after application of bias voltage. This should be a link to /entry/instrument/current_sensor/current_offset

group.name: BIAS_SWEEP
group.doc: Bias sweep measurement in bias spectroscopy. This should be a link to /entry/instrument/bias_spectroscopy_environment/bias_spectroscopy/bias_sweep

field.name: modulation_signal_type
field.doc: This is the signal on which the modulation voltage or current will be added. This should be a link to /entry/instrument/phase_lock_loop/modulation_signal

field.name: reference_frequency
field.doc:
The frequency of the sine modulation that is used as a carrier signal of input signal in lock-in.
This should be a link to /entry/instrument/lockin_amplifier/reference_frequency

group.name: resolution_indicators
group.doc: The group's concepts hold the link to the related concepts that define the resolution of the STM experiment.

field.name: head_temperature
field.doc: This should be a link to /entry/instrument/scan_environment/head_temperature

field.name: cryo_bottom_temperature
field.doc: This should be a link to /entry/instrument/scan_environment/cryo_bottom_temperature

field.name: cryo_shield_temperature
field.doc: This should be a link to /entry/instrument/scan_environment/cryo_shield_temperature

group.name: BIAS_SWEEP
group.doc: This should be a link to /entry/instrument/bias_spectroscopy_environment/bias_spectroscopy/bias_sweep

field.name: modulation_signal_type
field.doc: This is the signal on which the modulation voltage or current will be added. This should be a link to /entry/instrument/lockin_amplifier/modulation_signal_type

field.name: reference_frequency
field.doc: The frequency of the sine modulation that is used to modulate the signal in lock-in. This should be a link to /entry/instrument/lockin_amplifier/reference_frequency
